header.title: The Problem is Layered, Chronological, and Solvable
header.subtitle: Three interconnected problem areas affecting individual investors globally

layers.title: Environment
layers.subtitle: Environmental Layer
points: Even with access + ownership, there's no visibility
ESG scores are vague and untrusted

layers.impact: Financial markets are disconnected from planetary reality.
layers.supportingData: $3-5T/year private capital needed to bridge the gap. (Merkel, Kerry, WEF)

layers.title: Social
layers.subtitle: Client Layer
points: Investors with $50-$5,000 are excluded from real financial growth
No trustworthy, guided experience (clients left to DIY)
Excluded from capitalism - excluded from impact (but want impact)
layers.impact: This amplifies generational inequality and wealth lock-out.
layers.supportingData: -35% of global retail capital is passive and disempowered. (Bain & Co.)

layers.title: Governance
layers.subtitle: Institutional Layer
points: Gaining access still leads to disempowerment
layers.impact: Retail investors lose control and agency.
layers.supportingData: 83% want proxy votes, but can't exercise them. (Stanford)

summary.title: In an ideal world...
summary.left: The things we spend our money on grow and materialize.
summary.right: The companies we give our money to construct the reality we inhabit.
summary.realityCheck: But in reality the majority of individual investors, (who amount to about 35% of $135T global democratic investment market) are deprived of their choice to vote on activities of companies they invest in.
